僅在病人有感染時洗手
接觸體液時使用個人防護裝備
僅對傳染病患者進行隔離

鼓勵病人保持原始姿勢
避免清潔皮膚以防感染

nursing.problem: 在進行藥物配藥時，應遵守的『五對』原則是什麼？

性別、年齡、藥物、劑量、時間

檢查病人的意識與瞳孔反應

未經允許，不向無關人員透露患者病情

gre.problem: When the financial director started screaming and throwing food at his co-workers, the police had to come in to deal with his ______ behavior.
Aberrations in climate have become the norm: rarely a week goes by without some meteorological phenomenon making headlines. This sentence describes a(n) ______.
Physics textbooks can seem so ______ to the uninitiated that readers feel as though they are looking at hieroglyphics.
Civil rights icon Rosa Parks will forever be remembered for ______ refusing to give up her seat on a public bus--even after the bus driver insisted, she remained rooted in place.
Before the concert began, security personnel ______ the crowd not to come up on stage during the performance.
At the assembly, the high school vice-principal gave the students an ______ speech, warning them of the many risks and dangers of prom night.
An ______ is someone who professes great sensitivity to the beauty of art and nature.
The ______ design of the building was admired by architects around the world.
The new policy was an ______ of several different approaches to the problem.
The instructions were ______, leaving the students confused about what was expected.
The politician's speech was filled with ______ statements that were clearly false.
The manager's decision to ______ the new policy was met with resistance from the team.
The ______ disregard for the rules led to severe consequences.
The ______ landscape was a perfect setting for a peaceful retreat.
The ______ attempts to fix the problem only made it worse.
The company's profits began to ______ after the new product launch.
The politician's reputation was damaged by the ______ spread by his opponents.
The weather in the region is notoriously ______, changing from sunny to stormy in minutes.
The teacher decided to ______ the student for his disruptive behavior in class.
The senator faced ______ from the public for his controversial remarks.
The mother ______ her child for running into the street without looking.
The comedian's ______ made the audience laugh uncontrollably.
The new regulations will ______ the use of plastic bags in the city.
The clever student managed to ______ the teacher's question with a witty response.
The salary offered was not ______ with the level of experience required for the job.
The politician refused to ______ defeat, even after the election results were announced.
The ______ effects of smoking are well-documented and widely known.
The artist's work was ______, capturing the essence of the subject with precision.
The student was ______ about the new policy, unsure of its implications.
The symbol ______ the company's commitment to innovation and progress.
The new product was criticized for being ______, lacking originality.
The scientist was able to ______ the formula from the data collected.
The dictator's rule was ______, allowing no room for dissent.
The professor's lectures were ______, intended to teach and instruct.
The shy student was ______, hesitant to speak in front of the class.
Sam was ______ about studying for the exam because doing so ate up a lot of his time, yet he was able to improve his analytical skills.
Three Cups of Tea tells the story of a western man who hopes to ______ poverty and the lack of education in Afghanistan.
Even though she did not like the outdoors, Shirley was generally ______ and so her brother was able to persuade her to go camping.
His study plan for the GRE was at best ______; he would do questions from random pages in any one of seven test prep books.
According to those who do not believe in climate change, the extreme weather over the last five years is simply ______--average temps should return to average, they believe.
After finding an ______ in the data, she knew that she would have to conduct her experiment again.
Maria had an ______ for tour groups, often bolting to the other side of the museum as soon as she saw a chaperone leading a group of wide-eyed tourists.
His deep emotional involvement with these ideas is, in fact, ______ to the disattachment Buddhism preaches.
Mr. Thompson was so talented at teaching math that even normally ______ students took interest.
Widespread ______ among voters led to a very small turnout on election day.
The web is notorious for sandwiching ______ stories between actual news.
Neville Chamberlain, the British prime minister during WWII, tried to ______ Hitler and in doing so sent a clear message: you can walk all over us.
One of the ______ decrees in place during the emperor's rule is that all citizens pay him weekly homage at his palace.
Most college fraternities are known for ______ rituals that those hoping to join the fraternity must learn.
Picasso is generally considered the most ______ member of the Cubist movement.
His ______ life is the main reason he inspired so many followers, especially since he gave up wealth and power to live in poverty.
The old couple looked ______ on the teenagers seated next to them, whispering to each other, "They've got rings through their noses and purple hair!".
As all of the other campers cowered in their tents, Bill, armed only with a flashlight, ______ tracked down the bear that had raided their food.
She surprised her colleagues by having the ______ to publicly criticize the findings of a distinguished scientist.
Despite an ______ beginning, Mike's road trip became a series of mishaps, and he was soon stranded and penniless, leaning against his wrecked automobile.
His lifestyle of revelry and luxurious excess could hardly be called ______.
Since ______ desire is similar to gluttony or lust--sins of excess--it was listed as one of the seven deadly sins by the Catholic church.
The professor used such ______ expressions that many students in the class either fell asleep from boredom or stayed awake to complete his sentences and humor friends.
Herbert regarded the minister's remark as a mere ______ until Sharon pointed out profound implications to the seemingly obvious words.
The smile on her face ______ the pain she must feel after the death of her husband.
Tom said that he was arguing the matter purely for philosophical reasons, but his ______ tone indicated an underlying anger about the issue.
With the gold medal at stake, the gymnast awaited his turn, his quivering lip ______ his intense emotions.
Though Harry loved numbers, he found calculus ______.
American basketball players are always ______ when they go abroad--not only are they American, but some are over seven feet tall.
The ______ of the metal alloy are nickel, copper, and tin.
The author's inability to take a side on the issue was ______ by both his opponents and supporters as a sign of weakness.
A small ______ of those loyal to the king have gathered around the castle to defend it.
Those who show ______ during their prison terms--especially when under review by a parole board--often get shortened sentences.
Despite a low GPA, he ______ to get into college, going so far as to write his own glowing letters of recommendation.
In midsummer, there are ______ popsicle stands at the beach; in the winter, there are none.
Though the man could have at least alerted the police, he crouched ______ in the corner as the old woman was mugged.
Since Sarah did not want her husband to guess the Christmas present she had bought him, she only answered ______ when he would ask her questions about it.
Beethoven's musical genius ______ in the 9th Symphony, which many consider his greatest work.
Since John had left his banana peel at the top of the stairwell, he accepted ______ for Martha's broken leg.
Sally's parties are ______ affairs, and instead of the usual beer and music, there is tea and intellectual conversation.
You will obey the rules of ______ for this courtroom or spend the night in a jail cell, said the judge to the prosecutor.
If you ever have the chance to meet the president, stand up straight and be ______.
Count Rumford ______ the new theory of heat, demonstrating that it was wholly inadequate to explain the observations.
Lawyers use ______ tactics so that it takes years before the case is actually decided.
Fred has no formal medical training; while he likes to claim authority on medical issues, he is little more than a ______.
After watching his superior take rations from the soldiers, he quickly became ______ and rebelled.
What was once known as Czechoslovakia has since split into two ______, independent nations.
The potential juror knew the defendant, and therefore could not serve on the jury, which must consist only of ______ members.
A good scientist should be ______, focusing purely on what the evidence says, without personal attachment.
Before the effects of anesthesia were ______, patients had to experience the full pain of a surgery.
Bryan is ______ in his belief that the earth is flat, claiming that all pictures of a spherical earth are computer generated.
The witness said he signed the contract under ______ and argued that the court should cancel the agreement.
Joey was known for his ______ tastes in music, one moment dancing to disco the next "air conducting" along to Beethoven's 9th symphony.
Journalists favor an ______ style of writing, in which no unnecessary words are used and every sentence is as short as possible.
I recently read an article in the Times about whether good literature is ______ or not; specifically, does reading more make a person more moral.
Since Maggie's cough syrup, which had expired five years back, was no longer ______, she coughed through the night.
The dictator's abuse of human rights was so ______ that many world leaders asked that he be tried in an international court for genocide.
Just smiling--even if you are depressed--can ______ feelings of pleasure and happiness.
Youtube is great place to learn just about anything--an expert ______ finer points so that even a complete novice can learn.
Shakespeare is an ______ author in the English language, but I find his writing uninteresting and melodramatic.
John preferred to avoid equatorial countries; the intense sun would always leave him ______ after he'd spent the day sightseeing.
The restrictions of the Treaty of Versailles were so severe that they ______ deep hatred and resentment in the German people.
By the time we reach 60-years old, most of our habits are so ______ that it is difficult for us to change.
The lifespan of a mayfly is ______, lasting from a few hours to a couple of days.
The findings of the study were ______--the two researchers had different opinions on what the results signified.
I tried ______ the mosquitos in my apartment with a rolled up newspaper, but there were too many of them.
Before the Internet, the library was typically where you would find ______ readers.
Politicians are the masters of ______ morals; academics are the masters of ______ clarity.
Map collecting is an ______ hobby to most, but to geography geeks it is a highly enjoyable pasttime.
As a college student, Charlie ______ Marxism, growing his beard out and railing against the evils of the free-market.
Her sleeplessness ______ her cold--when she woke up the next day, her sinuses were completely blocked.
Though his childhood piano teacher was so ______, Max is thankful now, as a professional pianist.
The teenagers ______ the rock star, covering their bedrooms with posters of him.
The document clearly indicated that Nick was out of the state at the time of the crime, and so served to ______ him of any charges.
The CEO refused to ______ on the decision to merge our department with another one, and so I quit.
Despite many bookstores closing, experts predict that some form of book dealing will still be ______ generations from now.
The widespread belief that Eskimos have forty different words for snow is ______, based on one false report.
Whitney is ______ about her shoes, arranging them on a shelf in a specific order, each pair evenly spaced.
After having his pay cut, Phil spread vicious rumors about his boss, hoping to ______ a general feeling of discontent.
After her third pet dog died, Marcia was simply ______: this time even the possibility of buying a new dog no longer held any joy.
The President announced that the senators were about to reach a compromise, and that he was eager to read the ______ details of the bill.
While the real objects are vastly different sizes in space, the sun and the moon seem to have the same ______ size in the sky.
Compared to Juliet's passionate concern for human rights, Jake's non-stop concern about football seems somewhat ______.
Monte was no miser, but was simply ______, wisely spending the little that he earned.
I thought I would finish writing the paper by lunchtime, but a number of urgent interruptions served to ______ my plan.
I can't ______ a single piece of evidence James has presented, but I still don't trust his conclusion.
Even though Carly was only recently hired, she had the ______ to question her boss's judgment in front of the office.

At mile 23 of his first marathon, Kyle had all but given up, until he noticed his friends and family holding a banner that read, "Go Kyle"; ______, he broke into a gallop, finishing the last three miles in less than 20 minutes.
Lynne was ______: once, she had a fifteen minute conversation with a stranger before she realized the woman didn't speak English.
Sylvester says the most ______ things, such as telling a girl he liked that she was much prettier when she wore makeup.
The professor wanted to tell the jury in detail about his new book, but the lawyer said it wasn't ______ to the charges in the cases.
The Internet offers such a ______ of news related stories that many find it difficult to know which story to read first.
The ______ wings of a butterfly, which allow it to fly, are also a curse, so delicate that they are often damaged.
Often we think that great leaders are those who are ______, always in the middle of a large group of people; yet, as Mahatma Gandhi and many others have shown us, leaders can also be introverted.
At first I thought my niece was ______, but I then found myself buying her ice cream every time we passed a shop.
Cheryl rolled her eyes when she heard the lecturer's ______ advice to "be true to yourself."
Dinner at Billy's was more a punishment than a reward, since anyone who sat at the dinner table would have to listen to Billy's father's interminable ______ against the government.
With a team of new hires to train, Martha was constantly ______ with little questions and could not focus on her projects.
The ______ manager didn't believe that any of his subordinates could ever have an insight as brilliant his own.
Until the Spanish Armada was defeated in 1587, Spain had ______ over the seas, controlling waters stretching as far as the Americas.
Though everybody at the gym told Mikey to do cardio before weights, Mikey was a ______ and always did the reverse.
Lady Gaga, in challenging what it means to be clothed, is an ______ for wearing a "meat dress" to a prominent awards show.
Jackson Pollack was an ______ artist, totally breaking with tradition by splashing paint on a blank canvas.
Peggy's numerous ______ include wearing mismatched shoes, laughing loudly to herself, and owning a pet aardvark.
In the 1920s, the World Series was rigged--an ______ act which baseball took decades to recover from.
Since the politician preached ethics and morality, his texting of revealing photographs was ______, bringing shame on both himself and his party.
Taxes are one of the ______ laws of the land, so there is no use arguing about paying them.
The judge was not ______ since he had been bribed by the witness's family.

Dexter, distraught over losing his pet dachshund, Madeline, found the police officer's questions ______--after all, he thought, did she have to pry into such details as to what Madeline's favorite snack was?
Win or lose, the coach was always ______, never giving the athletes an easy practice or a break.
The teacher found it ______ that the student was late to school because he had been kidnapped by outlaws on horseback.
Hitler, like Napoleon, made the ______ move of invading Russia in winter, suffering even more casualties than Napoleon had.
In an ______ move, the defendant spoke out of order to say terribly insulting things to the judge.
The lawyer had an ______ mind, able in a flash to dissect a hopelessly tangled issue and isolate the essential laws at play.
The vast economic inequality of modern society is ______ with America's ideals.
Tom Sawyer seems like an ______ youth until Huck Finn enters the novel; even Sawyer can't match his fierce individual spirit.
Eating with elbows on the table is considered ______ in refined circles.
In an effort to fight ______, the president of the college introduced a new, stricter grading system.
The rise of the computer was an ______ shift in technology and culture.
Two-years in Manhattan had changed Jenna from an ______ girl from the suburbs to a jaded urbanite, unlikely to fall for any ruse, regardless of how elaborate.
Even though Tom didn't like his new boss, he decided to ______ himself to her in order to advance his career.
Venus, with a surface temperature that would turn rubber to liquid, is ______ to any form of life.
Everyone found Nancy's banter ______--except for Mike, who felt like she was intentionally picking on him.
His speech was so dense and confusing that many in the audience found it ______.
Plaque is ______: we cannot see it, but each day it eats away at our enamel, causing cavities and other dental problems.
Lilian could not help herself from being ______, commenting that the Queen's shoes were showing too much toe.

At first Manfred's teachers ______ to his parents that he was not suited to skip a grade; when his parents protested, teachers explicitly told them that, notwithstanding the boy's precocity, he was simply too immature to jump to the 6th grade.
Despite many calls for mercy, the judge remained ______, citing strict legal precedence.
Captain Ahab was an ______ captain whose reckless and fearless style ultimately leads to his downfall.
He is an ______ smoker and has told his family and friends that there is no way he will ever quit.
The physics lecture became so ______ that the undergraduate's eyes glazed over.
Once you enter your plea to the court, it is ______ so think carefully about what you will say.
North Korea maintains intense control over its population through a combination of ______ and cult of personality.
The political candidate and his supporters were ______ once it was clear that she had won.
The meaning of her paintings comes from a classical style which ______ modern themes.
While Martha always swooned over the hunky, ______ types in romantic comedies, her boyfriends inevitably were very talkative--and not very hunky.
Showing no patience, the manager utterly ______ the sales team that lost the big account.
As the sun beat down and the temperature climbed higher, we spent a ______ week lying around the house.
Uncle Frank was known for his ______, so his nephew was sad when he did not receive a present for his birthday.
To say that Gandhi's actions were ______ is the greatest understatement; he overthrew an empire without violence.
Students in the U.S. learn to ______ Jefferson, Franklin, and Washington because they are the founding fathers of the nation.
He was a great sportsman: in defeat he was complementary and in victory he was ______.
The scientist ______ that the extinction of dinosaurs was most likely brought about by a drastic change in climate.
As a child she was quite ______, but as an adult, she has become an adept dancer.
Officer Kelly was a ______, rarely following police protocols or adopting the conventions for speech common among his fellow officers.
The film was incredibly ______, introducing highly likeable characters only to have them succumb to a devastating illnesses by the end of the movie.
I can forgive her for her ______ but only because she is a child and is seeing what she can get away with.
The fact that Ella's moods were as ______ as the weather was problematic for her relationships--it didn't help that she lived in Chicago.
The Japanese noodle maker was ______ in making his noodles and would never let another person take over the task.
The politician never trusted journalists because he thought that they ______ his words and misrepresent his positions.
I can only spend so much time ______ your disagreements with your wife, and at certain point, you need to do it on your own.
In the morning, Harriat was unable to ______ Harry, if he happened to become angry, unless he had his cup of coffee.
Nancy found doing dishes a thoroughly ______ task, although Peter found a kind of Zen pleasure in the chore.
Uncle Charley was known for his ______, giving all seven of his nephews lavish Christmas presents each year.
The company ultimately went out of business because the ______ managers couldn't predict the changes in their industry.
There are a ______ of internet sites hawking pills that claim to boost energy for hours on end.
The GRE tests cumulative knowledge, so if you cram the night before it is, at best, likely to only have a ______ impact on your score.
Shirley was totally ______ when the angry motorist cut her off and then stuck his finger out the window.
Because of the ______ involved in this case, I hired an outside consultant to advise us and help.
The wide-eyed optimism of her youth was now ______ after she had worked many years in the criminal justice system.
Even the most ______ advocates for gun ownership must admit some of the dangers that firearms present.
Since this was her first time debating on stage and before an audience, Di's voice was ______ and quiet for the first 10 minutes.
After work, I was expecting my colleagues to be enthusiastic about the outing, but I found them in a state of complete ______.
Because the logic behind McMahon's side of the debate was so ______, his audience came out either completely confused or, worse, feeling they'd been tricked.
Compared to middle school students, who have an untamed wildness about them, high school students are somewhat more ______.
The unpredictable and ______ nature of deja vu makes it a very difficult phenomenon to study properly.
What I expected to be an intelligent, nuanced historical documentary turned out to be a poorly-produced ______ of the form.
Even though Jesse James was an outlaw, his killer, Robert Ford, is remembered more for his ______ actions than for eliminating a criminal and murder.
Many style guides recommend not using idioms in writing because these ______ expressions are uninteresting and show a lack of imagination on the part of the writer.
The soccer game was ______ when the monsoon rain began to fall.
The student ______ the teacher's authority by questioning the teacher's judgment on numerous occasions.
While the hiking instructor agreed that carrying a first aid kit could be a good idea under certain circumstances, he ______ the importance of carrying enough water.

The President's first statement on the subject was vague and open to competing interpretations, so when he spoke to Congress about the same subject later, he was careful to make his position completely ______.
In the courtroom, the lawyer was ______, using every manner of deceit and manipulation to secure a victory for himself.
Bob took a risk walking into the "Students Barbershop"--in the end he had to ______ the apparently drunk barber for giving him an uneven bowl cut.
Some students ______ between schools when deciding which to attend, while others focus only on one school.
While the other employees responded to the bad news in a measured way, Andrew responded in a ______ manner, tipping over his desk and shouting at the top of his lungs.
Even some of the most sacrosanct sporting events are not immune to ______, as many of the officials have received substantial bribes to make biased calls.
The professor, despite his soporific lectures, was ______ amongst his colleagues, publishing more papers yearly than all of his peers combined.
While we elect our leaders in the hope that every word they speak will be ______, history has shown that such a hope is naive.
Todd was noble after the divorce, choosing to say only complimentary things about Barbara, but Barbara did not hesitate to ______ Todd.
In giving Marcia a particularly ______ response, Paul caused people at every other table in the restaurant to turn around and look at them angrily.
The professor's ______ knows no bounds; he could talk through a hurricane and elaborate a point from one St. Patrick's Day to the next.
She did not think her vocabulary was ______, yet there were so many words that inevitably she found a few she didn't know.
She was ______ by nature, and many people were drawn to this free and playful spirit.

The mayor, despite his avuncular face plastered about the city, was hardly ______ -- some concluded that it was his ingratiating smile that allowed him to engage in corrupt behavior and get away with it.
Coach Ramsey took his newest player off the field after watching a few painful minutes of her ______ performance.
The new Cessna airplanes will be the ______ of comfort, offering reclining seats and ample legroom.
While the senator privately approved of gay marriage, he was unwilling to ______ for the cause in a public venue.
For all his surface affability, Marco was remarkably glum when he wasn't around other people.
The center of the city had sadly become a pit of penury, while, only five miles away, multi-million dollar homes spoke of ______.
Albert Schweitzer spent most of his life doing missionary work as a doctor in Africa, seeking no reward, apparently motivated only by ______.
Amy's name was very apt: she was so ______ that she was twice voted class president.
The boat was ______ supplied for its year at sea--no man would go hungry or thirst.
Wherever the bowl haircut teen-idol went, his legions of screaming fans ran through the streets ______, hoping for a glance at his boyish face.
In many ways, the Internet's transformative effect on society has been ______ to that of the printing press.
The governor's ______ toward his rival was only inflamed when the latter spread false lies regarding the governor's first term.
Harry was so unknowledgable that he was unaware the Egyptian pharaohs ______ the American Revolution.
Aunt Betty had ______ notions about marriage, believing that a man should court a woman for at least a year before receiving a kiss.
The Ivy League is considered the ______ of the secondary education system.
Nietzsche was known for using ______, sometimes encapsulating a complex philosophical thought in a mere sentence.
There is an ______ difference between those who say they can get the job done and those who actually get the job done.
Test day can be one of pure ______, as many students worry about their test scores.
Hoping to sound intelligent, Mary spoke in ______ English that was right out of Jane Austen's Pride and Prejudice--needless to say, she didn't have many friends.
The ______ of the Carlsbad water polo team is clear--they have a decade of championships behind them.
History ______ The Odyssey and The Illiad to Homer, but scholars now debate whether he was a historical figure or a fictitious name.
In the weekly paper, the editor ______ the governor for wasting hundreds of thousands of dollars in public projects that quickly failed.
Her fear that the new college would be filled with unknown faces was ______ when she recognized her childhood friend standing in line.
Ideally, the restaurant's ______ menu will expand its clientele and increase its profits.
Many of the factory workers are worried about being replaced by machines and computers that will work completely ______.
The Spanish conquistadors were known for their ______, plundering Incan land and stealing Incan gold.
Afraid to see the aftermath of the car crash, I ______ my eyes as we drove by.
The struggling videogame company put all of its finances into one final, desperate project to ______ bankruptcy.
Martin is an ______ birdwatcher, often taking long hikes into remote mountains to see some rare eagle.
Badgered by his parents to find a job, the 30-year-old loafer instead joined a gang of itinerant musicians.
Badgered by his parents to find a job, the 30-year-old loafer instead joined a gang of itinerant musicians. This word has other definitions but this is the most important one for the GRE.
The students were willing to clean up the broken glass, but when the teacher asked them to mop the entire floor, they ______, citing reasons why they needed to leave.
The most difficult part of the fast was ______ thoughts of food.
Often we imagine all monks to wear the ______ smile of the Buddha, but, like any of us, a monk can have a bad day and not look very happy.
Her dress was ______ and made her look even more beautiful. This word has other definitions but this is the most important one for the GRE.
Sitting all alone in his room, Harvey ______ the happiness of the other children playing outside his window.
The teacher looked down at the student and said, "It would ______ you to be in class on time and complete your homework, so that you don't repeat freshman English for a third straight year."
A good teacher will never ______ his students, but will instead empower them.
Known for their ______ ways, the Spartans were once the most feared people from Peloponnesus to Persia.
I remember my grandfather's face was wrinkled, ______, and calm.
After discovering a priceless artifact in her backyard, Jane was ______ by phone calls, emails, and reporters all trying to buy, hold or see the rare piece of history.
The prince's distasteful choice of words ______ not only his own name, but the reputation of the entire royal family.
Unremitting overcast skies tend to lead people to create ______ literature and lugubrious music -- compare England's band Radiohead to any band from Southern California.
Modern technology has been a ______ to the travel industry.
Not one for social pleasantries, the Chief of Staff would ______ ask his subordinates anything he wanted, even coffee.
The profits at our firm ______ the general downturn that effected the real estate industry. This word has other definitions but this is the most important one for the GRE.
China's economy has been ______ by a global demand for the electronic parts the country manufactures.
Some actors take challenging roles in which they have to lose so much weight that they appear ______.
Even with a perfect stranger, Charles was always ______ and would rarely hold anything back.
Although I was unhappy that the relationship ended, I appreciated her ______ about why she was ready to move on from the relationship.
Most cultures consider gambling a ______ sin and thus have outlawed its practice. This word has other definitions but this is the most important one for the GRE.
What seemed like incessant nagging and ______ about my behavior from my mother turned out to be wise and useful advice that has served me well.
Rosa Park's refusal to give up her bus seat acted as a ______ for the Civil Rights Movement, setting into motion historic changes for African-Americans.
Every fall, high school English teachers are inundated by requests to ______ their curriculum by removing The Catcher in the Rye and Scarlet Letter from their reading lists.

A ______ analysis of most pop music finds it to be simple and childish, but that ignores the point--the music's effect on the listener. This word has other definitions but this is the most important one for the GRE.
Martin Luther King Jr. ______ civil rights fiercely throughout his short life. This word has other definitions but this is the most important one for the GRE.
The ______ lives on both sides of the political spectrum, outright shunning anybody whose ideas are not consistent with his own.

Deserted for six months, the property began to look more like a jungle and less like a residence--weeds grew ______ in the front yard. This word has other definitions but this is the most important one for the GRE.

One by one, the presidential candidates dropped out of the race, their respective ______ pasts-- from embezzlement to infidelity--sabotaging their campaigns. This word has other definitions but this is the most important one for the GRE.
Marco's ______ ways, like opening doors and pulling out chairs, was much appreciated by his date.
In the final moments of the trial, during his closing speech, Phillips was nearly begging the judge for ______.
Over time, the various tribes ______ into a single common culture with one universal language.
A ______ argument will change the minds of even the most skeptical audience.
A well-written, ______ essay will keep on topic at all times, never losing sight of the main argument.
Many have argued that Lee Harvey Oswald, JFK's assassin, was in ______ with other criminals; others maintain that Oswald was a lone gunman.
Few appreciate the ______ scale of the sun: if hollow, it could contain a million Earths.
The efforts of the firefighters running into the burning building were ______.
After the water polo team won their sixth championship, they became ______ and didn't even make it to the playoffs the next year.
The head waiter was careful to tell the amateur diners that red wine was ______ with beef, each bringing out subtle taste notes in the other.
Her headache was ______ by the construction crew outside, which had six jackhammers going at the same time. This word has other definitions but this is the most important one for the GRE.
Studying in a quiet room is ______ to learning; studying in a noisy environment makes learning more difficult.
The queen was so ______ that, with the help of the prince, she tried to overthrow the king.
At the church of Notre Dame in France, the new High Altar was ______ in 1182.
He found pop music a ______ on his ability to learn and preferred to listen to classical musical while studying.
Tyler was the ______ musician: he was able to play the guitar, harmonica, and the drum at the same time. This word has other definitions but this is the most important one for the GRE.
Always on the forefront of fashion, Vanessa looked ______ at anyone wearing dated clothing.
Though he stole his little sister's licorice stick with malevolent glee, Chucky soon became ______ when his sister wouldn't stop crying.
Computers have helped solve some of the mathematical ______ which have puzzled man for many centuries.
The wedding reception was ______; friends who hadn't seen each other for ages drank and ate together before heading to the dance floor.
Instead of solving the math problem in three simple steps, Kumar used a ______ solution requiring fifteen steps.
